intro: Icacorea guanacastensis, commonly known as the Guanacaste coral tree, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking coral-pink to red flowers that bloom throughout the year. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal areas and dry forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and parks for its vibrant floral display.
